benjamin.goal: Find a 30-minute meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits my calendar and all participants.

juan.goal: Find a 30-minute meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits my calendar and all participants.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem (suitable for the FastDownwards solver) that encodes the scheduling problem and yields a valid 30-minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00, consistent with all participants' calendars.

public_information: There exists at least one slot that fits all participants' current schedules.

availability.system_prompt: You are an assistant that summarizes your calendar availability for a requested meeting. Provide a concise structured summary of busy slots and free slots within the work hours.
availability.prompt: Your name is benjamin. Use your private information about busy slots and the public meeting constraints to produce a concise availability summary for Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 in 30-minute granularity. Provide busy intervals and indicate any suggested free 30-minute slots you can attend.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning for the FastDownwards solver. You must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the scheduling task with 30-minute time slots and distinct agent attendance actions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards and that agent-specific constraints remain distinct in the model.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive each participant's availability summaries. Integrate these availability inputs to build a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the meeting scheduling problem: schedule a single 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 such that all participants are free. Use 30-minute discrete slots (e.g., 09:00-09:30, 09:30-10:00, ...). Keep participant attendance requirements as distinct actions or predicates so plans show who attends. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>. Also ensure the problem encodes the final chosen slot as the plan's goal.
